DOC.brief_summary: This Multicenter , randomize , open‐label , parallel group study test hypothesis prophylactic low molecular weight heparin ( LMWH ) ( enoxaparin ) initiate 14 week gestation could improve maternal perinatal outcome woman high risk develop placental‐mediated pregnancy complication .
DOC.brief_title: Low Weight Heparin prOphylaxis Placental‐Mediated Complications PrEgnancy
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman ≥18 year Gestational age < 14 week randomisation One follow complication previous pregnancy : Severe PE result delivery 32 week gestation Newborn weight less 10th percentile document abnormal Doppler umbilical artery pregnancy 32 week gestation Abruption placenta Unexplained intrauterine death 20‐41,6 week gestation secondary placental insufficiency Uterine arteries Pulsatility Index ( mPI ) Doppler ≥95th percentile 11‐14 week gestation . Multiple pregnancy Abnormal thrombophilia study Alcohol illicit drug use Severe fetal malformation chromosomal abnormality Previous history infertility ( 3 early miscarriage ) Maternal HIV , Cytomegalovirus toxoplasma infection Known fetal abnormality chromosomal defect randomisation Women previous venous arterial thrombotic event Organic lesion could increase hemorrhagic risk : gastric ulcus , stroke , recent hemorrhagic event , high risk situation hemorrhagic event Known allergy heparin LMWH , thrombopenia thrombosis episode due heparin treatment Contraindication LMWH An absolute indication anticoagulant therapy : venous deep thrombosis , pulmonary embolism , ovaric hyperestimulation , cardiophaty , others Metabolic disorder risk development PE and/or IUGR : Type I diabetes , hipertiroidism , chronic renal insufficiency
